relevant_communication: EMOTA is hosting each year the EU eCommerce Conference in Brussels, organized by Forum Europe. In addition, EMOTA is organizing events and other meetings in the EU institutions and not only, to help policy makers in removing barriers to cross-border trade across the EU.
goals__remit: EMOTA represents e-traders and distance sellers at European level, through its national member associations. At present, EMOTA has members in Austria, Belgium, Croatia, France, Germany, Greece, Estonia, Finland, Lithuania, Romania, Russia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Ukraine and the UK. Many legislative initiatives launched at EU level have been aiming at regulating sales over the internet and in particular, protecting consumers using the online channel for their shopping. EMOTA’s main focus lies on the encouragement of e-commerce and the removal of barriers to and facilitation of cross-border sales for the benefit of e-retailers with international ambitions.
